images.copyright: Aerial view of Churún Merú waterfall, Venezuela (© AirPano LLC/Amazing Aerial Agency)
images.title: Don't just dream it, stream it!
images.caption: Churún Merú waterfall in Venezuela
images.desc: In the heart of the wilderness, an awe-inspiring sight plummets from a mountain—the Churún Merú waterfall in Venezuela. Also known as Dragon Falls, the cascade featured in today's image is in a narrow niche at the southern end of the canyon that divides the mountain of Auyán-tepui. Falling from around 1,300 feet, Churún Merú is joined by a neighboring stream in the wet season. Venezuela is home to some of the world's most impressive natural wonders, including the highest waterfall on Earth, Angel Falls, found some 4 miles south of Churún Merú. So, whether you're after angels or dragons, Venezuela has a waterfall for you!
images.bsTitle: Don't just dream it, stream it!
